tags: IM GETTING THESE DONE I PROMISE
AND IVE BEEN VERY ASLEEP RECENTLY
the actual serpent of eden entering himself into a pet photo contest was funny to me
question: 22 for the prompt list ~
answer:
#22 “Choose me.”

“This is a contest then?” Aziraphale asks, puzzling over Crowley’s iPad. The screen was entirely too busy looking, all these bright colours and ostentatious movements. He does his best to pick out the important, relevant parts, but the adverts are distracting and he hasn’t figured out how to consistently identify them yet. Computers were all well and good, but Aziraphale hasn’t yet made up his mind about this internet business, or this touch-screen business—or even the Apple business—but he did like a few of the puzzle game apps.

“Mm-hmm,” says Crowley, using his index finger to scroll through the website’s image gallery. “It’s a calendar contest. You vote on the picture you most want to see included. It’s all submission based.”

“Sounds simple enough,” says Aziraphale, in the way people do when they don’t want to admit they’re not sure they grasp the concept entirely. He understood voting in contests fine, but wasn’t sure how it worked on this little… device.

“It is,” encourages Crowley, passing Aziraphale the tablet.

Aziraphale holds the thing doubtfully, distrustfully, and copies the way he’d seen Crowley manipulate the screen before. “There’s quite a few…” He trails off and narrows his eyes. “Crowley, this one is you.”

“Could be,” Crowley says passively, looking extremely interested in a knick-knack cluster he knows hasn’t changed, more-or-less, for three decades.

“Hmm, well, I must say there is such a large selection of…” Aziraphale flounders for the proper term. “Amphibians—”

“—Reptiles.”

“—And I couldn’t possibly choose just one to vote for.” Aziraphale punctuates his sentence by holding the iPad back towards Crowley.

“Choose me,” Crowley snaps, shoving the iPad back.

“Oh?” For having had a few millennia to practice, Aziraphale’s innocent expressions were in need of improvement. “I’m sorry, I thought that one wasn’t you.”

“Angel,” Crowley says, tone as fond as it was exasperated. “Has anyone ever told you you’re a bit of a bastard?”

summary: endless list of Good Omens AUs (1/?) Aziraphale & Crowley: The Prosecutor & the Defense Attorney The best friends all through...
caption:
endless list of Good Omens AUs (1/?)

Aziraphale & Crowley: The Prosecutor & the Defense Attorney

The best friends all through law school, Anthony Crowley and Ezra Fell were always an unlikely duo: Crowley liked murder mysteries, Ezra preferred Victorian romances; Crowley liked rock n’ roll, Ezra preferred classical suites; Crowley drank red wine and Ezra would only ever drink white. It was for their differences that they complemented each other so well. 

As the age old saying goes, “Opposites Attract.”

But when Crowley opts to go and work for a defense firm after graduation and Ezra gets appointed to work for the Crown, it appears that their differences may, at last, be too steep to overlook. After all, defense attorneys are the reason that criminals walk, free to terrorize the innocent; how could Ezra overlook something like that, in his line of work? It was his job to bring criminals to justice. He could hardly look his superiors in the eye and tell them he was in love with a defense attorney.

Crowley, on the other hand, thinks Ezra is being all too dramatic about it all. It’s only a job. A means to an end. Or, more accurately, a means to purchasing expensive classic cars…

…and maybe the occasional Dickens first edition, to soften the blow of his “falling from grace to serve the corrupt underworld of the criminal justice system.”

The bickering never stops, really, even years after the two have been married. Things really tend to heat up, for instance, when Crowley is given cases that Ezra happens to be prosecuting. 

Especially when he wins.

“That man was guilty, Crowley! I tell you, he was guilty and you let him go!”
“I didn’t let him go; the jury did. Can you pass the pepper?" 
”NO, I WON’T PASS YOU THE PEPPER. HE WAS A MURDERER.“

summary: The Stars Through Their Souls - Chapter 1 - CrayonWrites, thor20 - Good Omens - Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett [Archive of Our...
title: The Stars Through Their Souls - Chapter 1 - CrayonWrites, thor20 - Good Omens - Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/?
Fandom: Good Omens - Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett
Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
Warnings: Major Character Death
Relationships: Aziraphale/Crowley (Good Omens)
Characters: Aziraphale (Good Omens), Crowley (Good Omens), War (Good Omens), Famine (Good Omens), Death (Good Omens), Pestilence (Good Omens)
Additional Tags: Slow Burn, French Revolution, Pre-Canon, Grief/Mourning, Immortality, Mutual Pining, Fluff and Angst, Historical References, 18th Century
Summary:

This is not the apocalypse; it is just a fun game to pass the time until it comes. An angel and a demon aren’t quite sure that’s what they would call it, but they’re along for the ride whether they like it or not. The taste of revolution crawls forward on the air. People will die. People will be freed. Heaven and Hell pick no sides.

blog.name: goodomensheadcanons
blog.title: Good Omens Headcanons
blog.description:
Welcome to the Good Omens headcanons blog. This place is for all those little moments that totally happened offscreen (er, offpage) in the fantastic book Good Omens.

Founded by: Rowan

Sidebar art: hoursago.

If you are the social networking god known as Neil Gaiman and you have stumbled upon this, thank you.

summary: Aziraphale is selfconscious about his chubbiness and sometimes thinks Crowley is teasing him about it. But he soon discovers...
question: Aziraphale is selfconscious about his chubbiness and sometimes thinks Crowley is teasing him about it. But he soon discovers that Crowley likes nothing better than to rub his cheek catlike against Aziraphale's soft belly and bury his face in the little rolls of fat.

summary: Crowley is responsible for ominous positivity, it started when he was rather unsuccessfully trying to cheer Aziraphale up, but...
question: Crowley is responsible for ominous positivity, it started when he was rather unsuccessfully trying to cheer Aziraphale up, but it ended up catching on with the humans who heard.  Crowley: You will have a good day tomorrow Aziraphale, you have no choice. It is already waiting for you.

summary: Crowley tends to elongate his 's' pronunciation of he isn't paying attention to his speech. When he is drunk, tired, or just...
question: Crowley tends to elongate his 's' pronunciation of he isn't paying attention to his speech. When he is drunk, tired, or just very excited, it becomes more clear. It comes from his snake boy days, and he is a little embarrassed of it. Aziraphale thinks its sort of adorable.

summary: Do you like Good Omens? Do you want to scream with other people who like it?
title: Do you like Good Omens? Do you want to scream with other people who like it?
body:
Then my new discord server may just be the thing for you! Rules and join link under the cut!

1) Be Cool

    - This server has been created with the intent of being a place that all lovers of the book can share their thoughts, their love, their theories, their jokes, and more! It’s a place in which we hope to build connections and friendships! We ask that you be nice about that!

    - Discussion is allowed and encouraged! However, we ask that there be no arguments. If you can tell that something is getting out of hand, and that debate has turned into full blown arguing, please try to tone it down! We want this to be a supportive and welcoming environment.

    - As we want this to be a nice environment, there’s a few things we will not allow. Racism, homophobia, transphobia, and the like, will NOT be tolerated. Just try to be a decent person, yeah?

2) Keep It Cool

    - We have an age limit on this server! Our youngest age is 15, and our oldest is 25. We understand that there are a lot of older fans of the book, but seeing as the owner is only 17, we’d like to keep things around that age group.

    - The channel #absolute-absurdities is marked NSFW simply so that those who don’t want to be in that channel don’t have to be! It’s also a sort of warning. We do NOT have a channel for serious NSFW discussion. This channel is only for jokes and japes. Any serious conversations regarding NSFW content will be shut down by a mod.

3) Moderators Are Friendly

    - The mods are here to make things run smoothly and nicely! If you notice anything going against the rules that you want a moderator to take a closer look at, mark it with the  and dm a mod, please!

    - The blacklist is here to protect people! There is no channel for talking about things that are on the blacklist. PLEASE be respective of the items on the list. If you need anything added, please contact a mod!

Have fun!

https://discord.gg/SQW5ajt
body_abstract: Then my new discord server may just be the thing for you! Rules and join link under the cut!

blog.name: rustandruin
blog.title: Rust and Ruin
blog.description:
Emmerdale, Venom, Doctor Who, Good Omens, His Dark Materials, Neil Gaiman, Marvel,

Writer trash. Bisexual Mememon.

Please tell your dog I love them.

They/Them

summary: Hi rusty 👋 so I've been reading a few of your posts and replies and am I correct in thinking you are a fan of terry pratchetts...
question: Hi rusty 👋 so I've been reading a few of your posts and replies and am I correct in thinking you are a fan of terry pratchetts books ? I've recently seen some of his works not the books but the tv adaptations of some of his novels in the discworld and I enjoyed them I saw your posts on Good Omens and was wondering if you could tell me a bit about it's premise if you don't mind as I am a fan of mystery/sci stuff. Sorry for this rambly ask xx
answer:
Hello Anon!

Omg yes. It would be my absolute pleasure to introduce you to what is one thoroughly hilarious and very madcap book that I’m 90% sure will also be a TV series I will love. (Brief Disclaimer: This is my first Pratchett novel. And I’ve never really seen any of his adaptations. Though based on my love for this book and every quote I’ve read of his/heard about him, I’m sure I’d adore his books too.)

So. Good Omens is basically the story of the Apocalypse, and one Angel and one Demon who are trying to stop it, because after 6,000+ years, they’ve grown quite fond of humanity and Earth. (Aziraphale, the angel, is a huge book nerd who runs a bookshop where he does his best not to sell any of his precious literary belongings, and Crowley, the demon, drives a Bentley that only plays the Best of Queen on a loop, and is a plant dad with a very nice flat. They’re best friends who hang out a lot and are also pretty much husbands.)

When our story begins, the Antichrist has just been born, which means that time is ticking down until the world ends. Thus Aziraphale and Crowley decide that they’re going to join forces — irrespective of Heaven and Hell’s desires — and try and prevent the End Times from coming forth. Their big plan? To try and influence his upbringing so they can try and steer him away from evil. There’s only one problem that neither of them accounted for: Human Error.

Turns out, the babies were accidentally switched at birth and the Antichrist actually went home with a different family and had a relatively normal upbringing (i.e. no angels or demons serving as tutors or nannies or gardeners and trying to sway him to either side). Only now that it’s almost time for the Apocalypse, his powers are kicking in, and that’s where our adventure really gets going.

I hope you check out and read the book. It’s so much fun. Not quite a mystery or particularly sci-fi, but full of delicious parody and wordplay and humour, all of which has aged beautifully. Feel free to come back and tell me how you found the book, and if you have any Pratchett adaptation recs for me!

P.S. This was in no way rambly, and you are always welcome to do so in my askbox.
